settings.title: Visual
settings.text: Use this section to explain a set of product features, to link to a series of pages, or to answer common questions about your products. Add images for emphasis.

settings.title: Thermal
settings.text: Our products are built to provide better thermal performance while stationary. The two main factors that COS uses to drive this are breathability and the leverage of air as an insulator - some technologies deliver on one, some on both.

settings.title: Silent
settings.text: COS tech eliminates noise, even in cold temps where noise is amplified and more easily created.

Every technology Code of Silence develops and utilizes supports our key focuses of 100% silence, visual stealth, warmth / comfort, and ergonomic dexterity. Our technologies are far from “status quo” approaches however. These clearly represent different design strategies than have been seen in conventional systems. We’ve spent thousands of hours developing these designs and they are proven to be more effective in delivering in the field than traditional techniques. We are firm believers that that “if you want to get to a different place – you need to take a different path” and we are 100% confident you will agree that we have defined “a better way to go afield”.

Through our years in the field, we have taken our experiences and created an approach to camo and avoiding visual detection we feel is absolute perfection. We are not your run of the mill camo. This is a different approach – that yields different results.

It’s important to start with the right “zone” or target location in mind when creating a camo design. We surveyed dozens of hunters across the country and arrived at an average stand “mid-height” of 17.8 (18) feet. We then analyzed over 100 trees of the most predominant species found in the heart of whitetail country and arrived at an average branch size and density at this “18” foot mark for base of the S18 camo design. The core elements and foreground shapes in S18 closely mimic this average limb size and frequency.
